page.title: 01NORTH OF LANARK AND BEYOND
page.content: The block is mainly farmland with most of the interesting features in the four southerly squares. The River Mouse runs through these four squares in a step and often dangerous gorge with many cliffs. Most of the gorge is an area of special scientific interest and is owned by the nature conservancy council. There is a wide variety of trees in the gorge. There are three glasshouse establishments growing mainly tomatoes for which the Clyde Valley is famous. Two of the three now grow using the hydroponic system. The only community is a Cleghorn where some are employed at the metal and welding works at Cleghorn junction. Most people who are employed travel to Lanark or further afield for work. Temporary labour is hired for the tomato glasshouses late spring to early autumn. Conifers are found
